Clojure - Simple HTTP Server: A Clojure Wrapper for SimpleWebServer from JDK 18+

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Clojure, a dynamic programming language for the Java Virtual Machine, introduces a new tool for developers - the Simple HTTP Server. This server is a thin Clojure wrapper around the SimpleWebServer from JEP 408 for JDK 18+.

The Simple HTTP Server provides a simple and efficient way to implement a static HTTP server in Clojure. It is a dependency-free solution that allows developers to quickly serve static files and resources.

To use the Simple HTTP Server, developers can either use it from the Clojure REPL or from the shell using the clojure -X command. This flexibility makes it easy to integrate the server into existing workflows and projects.

With the Simple HTTP Server, developers can easily build and deploy web applications in Clojure, taking advantage of the language's expressive syntax and powerful concurrency features. It provides a convenient solution for serving static assets, such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files, making it an essential tool for web development projects.

The Simple HTTP Server is actively maintained and has a growing community of contributors. Developers can find the latest releases, packages, and documentation on the project's GitHub repository.

In conclusion, the Simple HTTP Server is a valuable addition to the Clojure ecosystem, offering developers a lightweight and efficient solution for serving static files and resources. Its simplicity and flexibility make it a great choice for web development projects in Clojure. Stay tuned for more updates and news from the Clojure community.
